components.description:
A friendly, cartoon-styled face of a tiger looking straight ahead. Generally depicted in yellowish-orange with black stripes on its forehead and cheeks, a white muzzle, and neutral expression.

Often used with a more affectionate tone than the full-bodied üêÖ Tiger.

Available as an Apple Animoji.
components.title: Tiger Face

title: Tiger Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal faces
emoji_net_data.definition: A tiger face, which is displayed on major platforms with¬†a cute cartoon¬†appearance. Tiger Face was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 a http://emojipedia.org/tiger-face/

bn:00089090v: To utter or emit low dull rumbling sounds

bn:00083380v: To make a loud, deep, hollow noise like the roar of an angry bull.
To make a loud noise in breathing, as horses do when they have a certain disease.
Make a loud noise, as of animal
To make a noise like the deep roar of a large animal.
To make a loud noise, as of animal.

bn:00012146n: Sound produced by fast air expansion induced by a lightning.
A loud, deep, prolonged sound, as of a large beast; a roar.
Sudden thunder; a shock of thunder, as opposed to reverberating rumble
Thunder is the sound made by lightning.
A low-pitched, resonant sound, such as of an explosion.
Thunder is the sound caused by lightning.
The sound of the shock wave produced by lightning

bn:00060436n: The tiger is the largest cat species, reaching a total body length of up to over curves and weighing up to in the wild.
Panthera tigris, the largest cat species
A large carnivorous animal (Panthera tigris) of the cat family indigenous to Asia.
Panthera tigris, a large predatory mammal of the cat family, indigenous to Asia.
Large feline of forests in most of Asia having a tawny coat with black stripes; endangered

bn:00010309n: Any of several large cats typically able to roar and living in the wild
The term big cat, while not a biological classification, is used informally to distinguish the larger felid species from smaller ones.

bn:00016668n: A mountain lion, by mispronunciation of "panther".
Large American feline resembling a lion
Large cat of the family Felidae native to the Americas
The cougar, also known as the mountain lion, puma, panther, painter, mountain cat, or catamount, is a large cat of the family Felidae native to the Americas.
Puma concolor, a large wild cat native to the Americas.
The mountain lion, cougar, Puma concolor.
Species of feline (Puma concolor) tawny-colored with black-tipped ears and tail.
A large cat also known as a puma, mountain lion, or panther

apple_vendor_description: The tiger face emoji on Apple devices features a striking and powerful countenance, rendered with meticulous detail. Its vibrant orange fur, bold black stripes, and piercing eyes are brought to life with Apple‚Äôs signature glossy 3D shading and realistic lighting, giving it a sense of ferocity and majesty. The soft rounded edges on its ears and snout maintain a friendly yet formidable presence, commonly used to convey bravery, strength, or a playful, energetic spirit.
